item.title: Meet Jenkins: A Guide to Automation
item.description:
‚ÄúBuild once, run anywhere.‚Äù That‚Äôs not a dream ‚Äî that‚Äôs Docker.

In this post, we‚Äôll break down Docker from the ground up. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or brushing up for deployment, this is your one-stop guide to Docker and its ecosystem.

üê≥ What is Docker?

Docker is an open-source platform that allows you to develop, ship, and run applications inside containers. Containers package your app along with its environment, dependencies, and tools ‚Äî making them portable, lightweight, and consistent across all platforms.

item.title: Meet Jenkins: A Guide to Automation
item.description:
What is Jenkins?

Jenkins is an open-source automation tool written in Java. It helps developers build, test, and deploy their software automatically, making Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) possible.

CI: Continuous Integration
Automatically building and testing code whenever changes are pushed. 
CD: Continuous Delivery
 Automatically deploying/releasing the code to production or staging. 

Together, CI/CD makes your workflow faster, safer, and hands-free.

In simple terms:

Jenkins watches your code and runs jobs (like building or testing) whenever you push changes ‚Äî saving you tons of manual work.
